intro: Lagotis glauca f. candida, commonly known as the white-flowered bluebell, is a botanical variant of the species Lagotis glauca, characterized by its pale blue to white petals. It is a herbaceous perennial native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere, typically found in woodland and meadow habitats. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. Botanically, it belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many familiar bellflowers.
